landing.about_text: is a research application tool to quickly and easily track the spread of COVID-19 by gathering anonymous symptom data. This means that we can more accurately estimate the prevalence of COVID-19 infections and help authorities make timely, data-driven decisions about protective measures.
landing.scope_text: The purpose of the Coronavirus Symptom Checker is to gather academic research information about the clinical presentation of COVID19. This system is not intended for the diagnosis or treatment of disease or other conditions, including COVID-19. All of the collected research data is anonymous. This research project was made possible through an academic partnership of NUIG with UL and Orreco.
landing.data_title: How will my data be used?
landing.data_text_p1: No personal data is collected by MyCovidSymptoms, meaning that all data captured is anonymous and there is no way for it to be connected back to an individual.
landing.data_text_p2: The aggregate anonymous data will be provided to the Irish health authorities to help with their planning and will be used in research by NUI Galway to help prevent and mitigate future pandemics.
landing.participate_text_p1: It’s easy. Simply click on “My Symptoms” in the bottom navigation bar, then click “Log Symptoms” on that screen.
landing.participate_text_p2: Your first time logging symptoms you will be asked for some basic demographic data (year of birth & sex). After that you can select your current symptoms, followed by providing a rough indication of your location.
landing.participate_text_p3: If possible, please log your symptoms every day.
landing.credits_text: MyCovidSymptoms is a collaboration initiative between NUIG, UL & Orreco and made possible by the open source project Fevermap.net
landing.about_current_participant_count: To this day, %{participantCount} users have used MyCovidSymptoms to report their symptoms.

entry.first_entry_disclaimer: Entries are submitted into the database based on your device. We would appreciate that you submitted your information from the same device every time. This will allow us to monitor your fever status better.
entry.submission_period_disclaimer: To prevent unnecessary data, submissions are restricted to once every 12 hours.
entry.first_time_disclaimer: As this is your first time using Fevermap, we will ask you a few questions first.
entry.these_questions_wont_be_repeated: These questions won't be repeated on future submissions.

questions.prompt_diagnosis: Have you been tested for COVID-19?
questions.awaitingTests: I am WAITING for a test
questions.positive_covid_diagnosis: I have tested positive for COVID-19
questions.gender_in_passport: Gender as stated in your passport or other government records
questions.location_determination_subtitle: Location is determined using location API. Make sure to allow location sensors.
questions.location_change_subtitle: To update location information, update the value in the county and town field.

entry.last_submission_was_done: You last submission was made at %{date}
entry.submission_count_text: You have entered you fever information
entry.currently_holding_a_streak_of: Your current consecutive days streak is:

success.offline_entry_queued: Seems like you are offline. Entry has been queued.
success.entry_send_failed_queued: Submission failed. Entry has been queued.

error.age_not_in_range: Given birth year is not in the allowed range (1900 - 2020).
error.fever_temp_value_invalid: The fever temperature value is not valid.
error.location_data_invalid: The given location data is invalid.
error.api_data_invalid: Data sent to the API was invalid.
error.do_not_submit_new_temp_until: Do not submit a new temperature until %{dateTime}

pwa_installer.title: Install Fevermap
pwa_installer.content: Fevermap can be installed as a Progressive Web Application. If installed, we can provide you with great extra features like faster runtime and push notifications (coming soon).
